fields.description:
*User Story*

As a system,

I want to have ‘Nationality’, ‘Industry’ and ‘Delivery Channel’ fields in Accounts section

So that we can sync it from LogixCRM and be able to calculate risk with KYC Risk Scoring Setting.





*Acceptance Criteria*

# In LogixPanel → Admin Portal → Accounts → Traders profile section. Add the following fields:
## Nationality
## Industry
## Delivery Channel
# Sync field data from CRM to LogixPanel of the following:
## Nationality
## Industry
## Delivery Channel (logic should be based on when the client complete the form and passed to CRM)
!564645.png|width=1920,height=967!
# Apply across all environments.
# PMO to conduct testing of the following:
## Complete form, which has passed to CRM.
## CRM data has passed LogixPanel.



{color:#ff5630}*Note: No QA needed for this story.*{color}

fields.summary: [KYC Risk Score] Risk Score Setting Page

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

fields.description:
*User Story:*

As an admin I want to add column ‘Risk’

So that compliance team can know the risk level of all individual accounts





*Design*:

[https://www.figma.com/file/AuxMEaiE9UJRRPc3vWIRsj/Risk-Setting?node-id=21%3A1449&t=pvn33H1phGbC8yuC-1|https://www.figma.com/file/AuxMEaiE9UJRRPc3vWIRsj/Risk-Setting?node-id=21%3A1449&t=pvn33H1phGbC8yuC-1]

!45345345hdfgedrg.PNG|width=560,height=527!



*Acceptance Criteria:*

# In LogixPanel Admin Portal ACY LTD and AU → Clients → Individual Accounts:
!Individual account (1).png|width=1440,height=924!
## Add *Risk column* to individual accounts. Value is high/low/medium/seek approval basis the total of individual risk score of all CRA fields
## Clicking individual accounts should have risk score calculation details (*refer to AC 2 below*)
# In individual trader’s profile page, add a section labelled, ‘*KYC Risk Score*’, which should contain a table of the following:
# !image-20221229-052253.png|width=865,height=583!
## Value of ‘Country of Residency’ is value of Country field from application
## Value of ‘Nationality’ is value of nationality field from application
## Value of ‘Industry’ is value of Industry field from application
## Value of ‘Employment’ is value of Employment field from application
## ‘Product Risk’ has defined preset value
## ‘Delivery Channel Risk’ is online hence score is 10
## Result is total of all five rows and risk rank is derived from overall risk rating table



{color:#ff5630}*Note:* {color}{color:#ff5630}QA does not need to conduct testing of calculate in this sprint. It will be in separate story.{color}

fields.summary: [KYC Risk Score] Risk Score Setting Page

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

fields.description:
*User Story*

As an admin I want to add *Calculate* button on top

So that risk level can be updated for all accounts





*Environment:*

All environments

 

 

*Background:*
From compliance point of view there is need of automatic assessment of all individual accounts basis users nationality, country of residence, industry and employment option selected in application form. KYC risk score setting page gives compliance team access to adjust the risk scores/level of these categories. Calculation of total risk score/level for individual accounts is evaluated as per settings thereby categorizing them as high/medium/low risk. - [~accountid:62cb7541afe495359d9d07c5]

 

 

*Designs (include user interactions):*

[https://www.figma.com/file/AuxMEaiE9UJRRPc3vWIRsj/Risk-Setting?node-id=6%3A839&t=OuAjoiRDvzDMhymm-1|https://www.figma.com/file/AuxMEaiE9UJRRPc3vWIRsj/Risk-Setting?node-id=6%3A839&t=OuAjoiRDvzDMhymm-1]





*Acceptance Criteria:*

# In LogixPanel → Admin Portal → Compliance → *KYC Risk Score Settings*' section:
## Add a ‘Calculate’ button at the top. This feature should have the following functionalities:
### Hovering on calculate button shows ‘{color:#36b37e}*Clicking the button will update the risk score of all customers as per latest changes’*{color}
### Clicking calculate will give pop up ‘ This will update the risk level of all individual accounts’
### Clicking confirm updates the risk level of individual accounts as per changes
### Cancel button disregards changes
### Editing any of the tables makes calculate button disabled
## Implement calculate logics as follows:
### Overall risk rating (already in LogixPanel)
### Nationality {color:#ff5630}(to be synced from CRM in story: {color}[https://zerologix.atlassian.net/browse/LP1-3837|https://zerologix.atlassian.net/browse/LP1-3837|smart-link]{color:#ff5630}){color}
### Country of residency (already in LogixPanel)
### Industry {color:#ff5630}(to be synced from CRM in story: {color}[https://zerologix.atlassian.net/browse/LP1-3837|https://zerologix.atlassian.net/browse/LP1-3837|smart-link]{color:#ff5630}){color}
### Employment status  (already in LogixPanel)
### Product Risk  (already in LogixPanel)
### Delivery Channel Risk{color:#ff5630} (to be synced from CRM (logics is based on when client has completed the form) in story: {color}[https://zerologix.atlassian.net/browse/LP1-3837|https://zerologix.atlassian.net/browse/LP1-3837|smart-link]{color:#ff5630}){color}
## In case there is mismatch of entry coming from application form and value in table set it as default {color:#ff5630}*Blank*{color}
# Apply to all relevant environments.



{color:#ff5630}*Note:* {color}{color:#ff5630}QA does not need to conduct testing of calculate in this sprint. It will be in separate story.{color}

attachment.filename: CRA (simple) individual v4 (for AML CTF Program) 29dec.xlsx

fields.summary: [KYC Risk Score] Risk Score Setting Page

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

fields.description:
*User Story*

As an admin,

I want to open list of employment on same page

So that compliance team can change risk level of employment category.





*Environment:*

All environments





*Background:*
From compliance point of view there is need of automatic assessment of all individual accounts basis users nationality, country of residence, industry and employment option selected in application form. KYC risk score setting page gives compliance team access to adjust the risk scores/level of these categories. Calculation of total risk score/level for individual accounts is evaluated as per settings thereby categorizing them as high/medium/low risk. - [~accountid:62cb7541afe495359d9d07c5] 





*Designs (include user interactions):*

[https://www.figma.com/file/AuxMEaiE9UJRRPc3vWIRsj/Risk-Setting?node-id=78%3A2158&t=wk6HXzKaUME6es2R-1|https://www.figma.com/file/AuxMEaiE9UJRRPc3vWIRsj/Risk-Setting?node-id=78%3A2158&t=wk6HXzKaUME6es2R-1]





*Acceptance criteria:*

# In LogixPanel → Admin Portal → Compliance → *KYC Risk Score Settings*' section:
# !image-20221229-050742.png|width=605,height=338!
## Hovering on ‘*Employment List*’ button should show message, “{color:#36b37e}*Risk level of employment status can be managed here*{color}”
## Clicking on ‘*Employment List*’ button should take the user to ‘*Employment Status Score*’ section on the same page.
# Hovering on ‘*Delivery Channel Risk*’ button should show message, “{color:#36b37e}*Risk level of delivery channels can be managed here*{color}”
# Clicking on ‘*Channel List*’ button should take the user to ‘*Delivery Channel Score*’ section on the same page.
# In ‘*Employment Status Score*' and *'Delivery Channel Score*’ section:
# !image-20221229-050855.png|width=647,height=732!
## Populate employment/delivery channel and risk level as per excel sheet attached
## Clicking Edit allows changing risk level and enables cancel/save button
## Risk level can be changed through dropdown(High, Medium, Low)
## Changing risk level automatically changes the risk score as per employment status/delivery channel risk table in risk score settings page
## Clicking Save button saves changes
## Clicking Cancel button discards changes
## Clicking ‘<-- Back’ link should return the user to the ‘*Risk Score Settings*’ section
# Clicking *Add* button shows pop up with text field for employment status name and risk level can be assigned from risk dropdown. Click {color:#36b37e}*Add*{color} to confirm and {color:#36b37e}*Cancel*{color} to cancel
# No duplicate rows can be added. Error message to be shown ‘This row already exists, kindly check’ with Ok button.
# Selecting checkbox of employment categories shows *Delete* button(Add button/Edit button hides) 
# Clicking *Delete* shows pop up 'This will permanently delete all the selected rows(#number selected). Clicking {color:#36b37e}*Delete*{color} deletes row, {color:#36b37e}*Cancel*{color} button discards selection
# In case there is mismatch of entry coming from form and value in table set it as default *Blank*
# After discussion with Yick(18/1/2023): change text of ‘Online’ to ‘Online Application Form’ , Chinese: 在线申请表

13. As per discussion on 18/2023 with [~accountid:6191bb4debce47006794773d] [~accountid:62538eb7cdc240007049cc33] [~accountid:6383fac18fd2d2d5f12f272c] in order to match the input entry from form and the values in industry/nationality/country/delivery list English/Chinese values will be separated page wise. Also the pop up will show chinese value field

!MicrosoftTeams-image (29)-20230118-225120.png|width=1436,height=623!

!MicrosoftTeams-image (28)-20230118-225115.png|width=985,height=545!

Duplicate row error message design:

fields.summary: [KYC Risk Score] Risk Score Setting Page

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

fields.description:
*User Story*

As an admin,

I want to open list of Industry on same page

So that compliance team can change risk level of industries.





*Environment:*

All environments





*Background:*
From compliance point of view there is need of automatic assessment of all individual accounts basis users nationality, country of residence, industry and employment option selected in application form. KYC risk score setting page gives compliance team access to adjust the risk scores/level of these categories. Calculation of total risk score/level for individual accounts is evaluated as per settings thereby categorizing them as high/medium/low risk. - [~accountid:62cb7541afe495359d9d07c5] 





*Designs (include user interactions):*

[https://www.figma.com/file/AuxMEaiE9UJRRPc3vWIRsj/Risk-Setting?node-id=39%3A1388&t=wk6HXzKaUME6es2R-1|https://www.figma.com/file/AuxMEaiE9UJRRPc3vWIRsj/Risk-Setting?node-id=39%3A1388&t=wk6HXzKaUME6es2R-1]





*Acceptance criteria:*

# In LogixPanel → Admin Portal → Compliance → ‘*KYC Risk Score Setting*’ section:
## !image-20221229-051340.png|width=674,height=161!
Hovering on ‘*Industry List*’ button shows ‘{color:#36b37e}*Risk level of industries can be managed here’*{color}
## Clicking on ‘*Industry List*’ button should take the user to ‘*Industry Risk Score*’ section on the same page.
# In ‘*Industry Risk Score*’ section:
## !image-20221229-051453.png|width=779,height=521!
Populate industries and risk level as per excel sheet attached
## Clicking Edit allows changing risk level and enables cancel/save button
## Risk level can be changed through dropdown(High, Low)
## Changing risk level automatically changes the risk score as per industry table in risk score settings page
## Clicking Save button saves changes
## Clicking Cancel button discards changes
## Clicking ‘<-- Back’ link should return the user to the *‘Risk Score Settings*’ section

3. Clicking *Add* button shows pop up with text field for industry name and risk level can be assigned from risk dropdown. Click {color:#36b37e}*Add*{color} to confirm and {color:#36b37e}*Cancel*{color} to cancel

4. No duplicate rows can be added. Error message to be shown ‘This row already exists, kindly check’ with Ok button.

5. Selecting checkbox of industries shows *Delete* button(Add button/Edit button hides) 

6. Clicking *Delete* shows pop up 'This will permanently delete all the selected rows(#number selected). Clicking {color:#36b37e}*Delete*{color} deletes row, {color:#36b37e}*Cancel*{color} button discards selection

7. In case there is mismatch of entry coming from application form and value in table set it as default *High*

attachment.filename: CRA (simple) individual v4 (for AML CTF Program) 29dec.xlsx

fields.summary: [Part 2: Testing & Implementation] Checking MT4/MT5 Account Status for Deposits, Withdrawals and Internal Transfers in LogixPanel

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.
status.name: In Progress

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

fields.description:
*User Story*

As a system,

I want to implement new logics for checking and verifying MT4/MT5 Account Status for Deposits, Withdrawals and Internal Transfers in LogixPanel

So that I do not rely and wait for Thrift’s response. 



*Background*

Follow up story to [https://zerologix.atlassian.net/browse/LP1-2904|https://zerologix.atlassian.net/browse/LP1-2904|smart-link].

----

*Report by* [~accountid:6191bb4debce47006794773d] and [~accountid:61d4f155326554006c015f63]:

*Findings*

The current Internal Transfer workflow works under normal circumstances:

Step 1. LP sends cmd to Thrift to withdraw from Source Account.
Step 2. Wait for Thrift to respond- Successful, Failed, Timeout.
Step 3. If successful, issue cmd to Thrift to deposit into Destination Account.
Step 4. Wait for Thrift to respond- Successful, Failed, Timeout.
{color:#ff5630}Step 5. {color}If successful, do nothing; If Failed or Timeout, issue command to Thrift to deposit into Source Account.

 

The scenario that we observed for the current issue is that, at {color:#ff5630}Step 5{color},  LogixPanel kept receiving Timeout from Thrift, although the deposit to Destination Account was actually successful.

And since Timeout is treated as Failed, LogixPanel issues the command to Thrift to deposit into Source Account.

 

*Further findings*

Our current Withdraw and Deposit workflow only check Thrift's response, it does not verify the status of MT4 or MT5 account.

With the current logic workflow, it is likely to happen again if the Thrift timeouts at {color:#ff5630}Step 5{color} in the future.

----





*Acceptance Criteria*

* Proposed long-term solution by [~accountid:6191bb4debce47006794773d] and [~accountid:61d4f155326554006c015f63]:
** Immediately after every Withdraw and Deposit, add a checking to verify MT4 and MT5 account status; so that we don't only rely on Thrift's response.
** The logic implementation should cover the following conditions:
*** The combination of Source Account and Destination Account can be either MT4 or MT5 account.
*** The method to check MT4 and MT5 account status differs.
*** The check of MT4 account status is via TCP socket connection.
*** The check of MT5 account status is via Web API.
* Research solutions.
* Conduct testing for the following internal transfers:
** MT4 to MT4
** MT4 to MT5
** MT5 to MT5
** MT5 to MT4
fields.summary: [Part 1: Research] Checking MT4/MT5 Account Status for Deposits, Withdrawals and Internal Transfers in LogixPanel
[QA] Document verification
